description: Borrowed from Hindi कोतवाल (kotvāl); see there for more.

entries.meaning: (historical) The leader of a kot or fort in medieval India.
The local police chief or magistrate of a town or city in India or the East Indies.
examples: Why do people pay taxes, offer their wrists for manacling when the kotwal or even an ordinary policeman shows up at the door to arrest a man who is accused of committing a theft or murder?
